title: Evelyne Kestemberg
text:
Evelyne Kestemberg (; 28 May 1918 – 17 April 1989) was a French <a href="psychoanalyst">psychoanalyst</a>. She was born in <a href="Istanbul">Istanbul</a> and died in <a href="Paris">Paris</a>.
Biography.
Being married to Jean Kestemberg, she was a trained philosopher. She was first analysed by Marc Schlumberger and decided to dedicate her life to psychoanalysis. She was tutored by <a href="Sacha%20Nacht">Sacha Nacht</a>, who was against her admission to the SPP given she was not a trained physician.
